intro: Rhinanthus alpinus, commonly known as the alpine snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its bright orange or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous areas. It has a slender, erect stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Rhinanthus alpinus is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor environments.
